Springfield.Mills-Hale-Owen Blocks: The Mills—Hale—Owen Blocks were a collection of three historic mixed-use commercial and residential blocks at 959—991 Main Street in the South End of Springfield, Massachusetts. They occupied an entire city block on the east side of Main Street, between Union and Hubbard Streets. The Mills and Hale blocks were both built in 1874, and were two of the best examples of Italianate architecture of the period in the city.
